intro: Reseda lutea var. pulchella, commonly known as the yellow weed or goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of a single, bright yellow corolla. Reseda lutea var. pulchella is often used in traditional medicine and has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties.
